title: Power - V and I values for resistors X Y and Z

content.question:
Potential Difference
Current

Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>

<math alttext="5.0 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></math>
<math alttext="0.20 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></mstyle></math>

The table shows the potential difference across and current in three different resistors that are in the same circuit, which is not shown. Which of the following claims about the power dissipated by the resistors is true?

choices.label: Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> dissipates more power than Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

Resistors <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> dissipate the same amount of power.

Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> dissipates more power than Resistor <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>.

Resistors <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> dissipate the same amount of power.

content.answer: Resistors <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> dissipate the same amount of power.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
